author: DoonsterBuildsLego
title: Simple model and cheap way to get new Spiderman figure
review:
Summary: a cheap way to get hold of the new Spiderman minifig, with inevitable simple build as befits the 4+ rating.

Buld-wise, this is nothing to write home about. Certainly for adult builders it offers nothing, but may be of interest to younger builders.

The parts are quire good. Th main attraction is the Spiderman figure with the printed arms. Shame about the plain legs, but still a good figure.

The new "quad bike" shells are also quite versatile. I converted it to a trike as that seems to fit this set a little better, but I can also see me using it as a basis for other builds — I'm particularly intrigued about the possibility to use them as the basis for agricultural trailers & accessories.

There is also the re-coloured technic pin without friction (part 3673) in yellow.

It's got pretty basic play function: the quad bike, a mini catapult & the 2 minifigs. My daughter isn't into superheroes, so wasn't much interested.

As for value, depends on how much you value to Spiderman figure & like the look of the quad bike. For those, I found it decent value as an AFOL.
